Definition: Given a review from Amazon and a category of the product, you task is to classify whether the given category matches the review. If the given review and its category match, generate "True", otherwise generate "False".

Positive Examples.input:
Review: Arrived broken. Manufacturer defect. Two of the legs of the base were not completely formed, so there was no way to insert the casters. I unpackaged the entire chair and hardware before noticing this. So, I'll spend twice the amount of time boxing up the whole useless thing and send it back with a 1-star review of part of a chair I never got to sit in. I will go so far as to include a picture of what their injection molding and quality assurance process missed though. I will be hesitant to buy again. It makes me wonder if there aren't missing structures and supports that don't impede the assembly process. 
 Category: furniture
Positive Examples.explanation: It's the correct category. Because the customer gives a review of the product which belongs to the furniture category, which we can see it from the way the customer describes his experience sharing how he unpackaged his chair.

Positive Examples.input:
Review: the cabinet dot were all detached from backing... got me 
 Category: home_improvement
Positive Examples.explanation: It's the correct category. Because the product belongs to the home_improvement category, we can see it in the review where the customer mentions a cabinet dot.

Positive Examples.input:
Review: I got this with 50% charge. Put it under the sun. two days later, it has 25%. Never able to charge it once. Should have returned it right away. 
 Category: utensils
Positive Examples.explanation: It's an incorrect category. Because the product belongs to the electronics category and not utensils. Because the customer shared his experience related to the charging issue.

Negative Examples.explanation: It's only supposed to generate True or False.

Negative Examples.explanation: It should either return True or False not both.
